private_information: I am agent_alpha and I execute the odd-numbered actions from the sequence.

Assigned actions: 1: unstack(B,A), 3: unstack(F,H), 5: unstack(B,A), 7: unstack(I,L), 9: unstack(F,J), 11: pickup(A), 13: pickup(H), 15: unstack(I,D), 17: pickup(B), 19: unstack(D,K), 21: unstack(A,J), 23: unstack(J,E), 25: unstack(A,D), 27: unstack(H,F), 29: unstack(D,B), 31: unstack(H,F), 33: unstack(B,I), 35: unstack(A,J), 37: unstack(B,H), 39: unstack(B,H).
I can observe blocks that I manipulate and must report the state changes after each of my actions.
agent_alpha.goal: Execute assigned manipulations in sequence, update and report block state after each action, and provide a final state report to the orchestrator.

private_information: I am agent_beta and I execute the even-numbered actions from the sequence.

Assigned actions: 2: stack(B,A), 4: stack(F,J), 6: putdown(B), 8: stack(I,D), 10: stack(F,L), 12: stack(A,J), 14: stack(H,F), 16: putdown(I), 18: stack(B,I), 20: stack(D,B), 22: stack(A,D), 24: stack(J,K), 26: stack(A,J), 28: stack(H,F), 30: stack(D,E), 32: stack(H,D), 34: stack(B,H), 36: stack(A,I), 38: stack(B,H), 40: stack(B,A).
I can observe blocks that I manipulate and must report the state changes after each of my actions.
agent_beta.goal: Execute assigned manipulations in sequence, update and report block state after each action, and provide a final state report to the orchestrator.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate reports from agent_alpha and agent_beta and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that captures the final arrangement of the blocks.

public_information: This is a standard BlocksWorld domain where only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks involved: A B C D E F G H I J K L.

Initial arrangement: A is on the table, B is on top of A, C is on the table, D is on top of K, E is on top of C, F is on top of H, G is on the table, H is on the table, I is on top of L, J is on top of E, K is on the table, L is on top of G.
The agents will execute a fixed ordered sequence of 40 actions listed and the orchestrator must compute the final arrangement after those actions.

Planned action sequence: 1 unstack(B,A), 2 stack(B,A), 3 unstack(F,H), 4 stack(F,J), 5 unstack(B,A), 6 putdown(B), 7 unstack(I,L), 8 stack(I,D), 9 unstack(F,J), 10 stack(F,L), 11 pickup(A), 12 stack(A,J), 13 pickup(H), 14 stack(H,F), 15 unstack(I,D), 16 putdown(I), 17 pickup(B), 18 stack(B,I), 19 unstack(D,K), 20 stack(D,B), 21 unstack(A,J), 22 stack(A,D), 23 unstack(J,E), 24 stack(J,K), 25 unstack(A,D), 26 stack(A,J), 27 unstack(H,F), 28 stack(H,F), 29 unstack(D,B), 30 stack(D,E), 31 unstack(H,F), 32 stack(H,D), 33 unstack(B,I), 34 stack(B,H), 35 unstack(A,J), 36 stack(A,I), 37 unstack(B,H), 38 stack(B,H), 39 unstack(B,H), 40 stack(B,A).

report.system_prompt: You are agent_alpha participating in a BlocksWorld execution. Produce a precise chronological report of the actions you executed and the resulting state of affected stacks after each action. Do not emit PDDL. The orchestrator will consume your report to build the final planning instance.

You are agent_beta participating in a BlocksWorld execution. Produce a precise chronological report of the actions you executed and the resulting state of affected stacks after each action. Do not emit PDDL. The orchestrator will consume your report to build the final planning instance.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the chronological reports from the two agents to reconstruct the full stepwise state evolution. From the final state produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. You must keep actions of the two agents conceptually distinct when integrating their reports. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility: use STRIPS-style predicates and no extensions beyond standard PDDL used by FastDownwards.
